snippet: Facing a challenge from the right, the pro-Western president, Boris Tadic, will ask Serbian voters for a fresh mandate in voting expected in May.
abstract: Pres Boris Tadic of Serbia resigns to hasten an early election, hoping that he can translate his popularity into a fresh mandate in a new election expected to be held in May; he faces a stiff challenge from Tomislav Nikolic, a former strident nationalist who has remade himself as a moderate favoring Serbia’s ties to the European Union
lead_paragraph: Facing a challenge from the right, the pro-Western president, Boris Tadic, will ask Serbian voters for a fresh mandate in voting expected in May.

headline.seo: Serbian President Resigns to Force Early Election
headline.main: Serbian President Resigns to Force Early Election
